If there is an error (such as missing a required field like e-mail address) then an error message is displayed when navigating between tabs in an adjuster profile. This prevents the success message when saving a record which can lead to uncertainty. It also disables the "Last Updated by:" at the bottom, showing only as blank.

This may be able to be fixed alongside changes made in BS-16 since part of that process is to disable the "autosave" feature. We implemented a check upon tab change to see if there were changes, and if so, save those changes. We can easily add in an additional check that if the save does not return a success, we prevent moving from one tab to the other. This should allow the user to fix or undo the problem.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1586453430066,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-32","author":"rdupont","authorFullName":"Rick Dupont","issueId":"BS-2","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

As far as I can tell, this is a field in the database that a few different methods will change to a given status (1 = No, 2 = Yes, 3 = "DNR", 4 = "Currently Deployed").

So it's less of a formula and more of a series of different functions that will set it based on that action or condition. The methods to accept/reject a deployment will set it to either 2 (reject) or 4 (currently deployed). The user profile update page will manually change it to whatever is set in the drop down (unless DNR is selected, then it will set it to that). And the deployment end function is supposed to set them to 2 (Yes), which as BS-12 shows does not work as expected.

That's all I could find so far.

@Kris Anolfo so from what I can tell, on initial user set up a user is considered deployable as long as they are not flagged as "DNR". Upon update of a user profile, again a user is set as Deployable as long as they are not currently deployed and are not flagged as DNR.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1586805118132,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-36","author":"rdupont","authorFullName":"Rick Dupont","issueId":"BS-31","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Hey @Kris Anolfo, it looks like most if not all of the emails are in the "resources -> views -> notifications" folder on the git repository. The "Request Update" email uses the generic "default.blade.php" template.

  • Welcome Email - "welcome.blade.php"
  • Training Email - training.blade.php
  • Standy - standby.blade.php
  • New User - new-user.blade.php
  • Deploy - deploy.blade.php
  • Request Update - default.blade.php

The Rejected Deployment Request is less of an email and more of a response page. That is found in "resources -> view -> deployments"

  • rejected - reject.blade.php
  • accept - accept.blade.php
  • accept standby - accept-standy-blade.php
  • accept training - accept-training-blade.php
  • (New) Cutoff reject - cutoff.blade.php
  • Error page - error.blade.php

That's what I can see so far.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1581951835905,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-1","author":"Kanolfo","authorFullName":"Kris Anolfo","issueId":"BS-8","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Garth Murray the problem we have with this data is is twofold.

  1. On the 1099 employment application the adjuster is asked if they have their own policy and if they do they are instructed to provide their WC information by typing in the policy company name, policy number or self-insurance permit number, coverage start and end dates, and then upload a photo of the policy. Instead of uploading a copy of their policy they'll upload a copy of their driver's license or a picture of their cat.

  2. In BridgeSource the field Workers Compensation Deduction (should) defaults to not reviewed until admin reviews the adjuster's employment application. They will change the field to deduct from payroll if the adjuster does not carry their own policy and wants to enrol in ours or no deduction if the adjuster has provided correct WC information.

The first problem is what to do with those who state they have their own policy, but did not provide the required information thus requiring some sort of follow up from the admin team, The Workers Compensation Deduction dropdown options of not reviewed, deduct from payroll, and no deduction don't fully apply to them yet because they did not provide the required information. Having a third option such as invalid documentation would help identify these adjusters.

The second problem is that we are not capturing any of their WC data in their profiles - none of the data they provide is being entered into their profile and there's no place to upload the documentation they send to us. I don't think we need text fields for policy company name or policy number if we are going to upload the policy itself. However I do think we should capture coverage start date and coverage end date. Knowing these dates will allow us to determine if the adjuster had coverage during the days they were deployed to a project (since the projects should capture start and release dates) and could also help us track adjusters who have expired policies - maybe having those with coverage end date after "today" can automatically turn to invalid documentation.

This may be able to be fixed alongside changes made in BS-16 since part of that process is to disable the "autosave" feature. We implemented a check upon tab change to see if there were changes, and if so, save those changes. We can easily add in an additional check that if the save does not return a success, we prevent moving from one tab to the other. This should allow the user to fix or undo the problem.

@Kris Anolfo just to clarify, we want new inputs on just the admin adjuster view to capture policy company name, policy number, and effective dates or on both?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1581951835905,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-1","author":"Kanolfo","authorFullName":"Kris Anolfo","issueId":"BS-8","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Garth Murray the problem we have with this data is is twofold.

  1. On the 1099 employment application the adjuster is asked if they have their own policy and if they do they are instructed to provide their WC information by typing in the policy company name, policy number or self-insurance permit number, coverage start and end dates, and then upload a photo of the policy. Instead of uploading a copy of their policy they'll upload a copy of their driver's license or a picture of their cat.

  2. In BridgeSource the field Workers Compensation Deduction (should) defaults to not reviewed until admin reviews the adjuster's employment application. They will change the field to deduct from payroll if the adjuster does not carry their own policy and wants to enrol in ours or no deduction if the adjuster has provided correct WC information.

The first problem is what to do with those who state they have their own policy, but did not provide the required information thus requiring some sort of follow up from the admin team, The Workers Compensation Deduction dropdown options of not reviewed, deduct from payroll, and no deduction don't fully apply to them yet because they did not provide the required information. Having a third option such as invalid documentation would help identify these adjusters.

The second problem is that we are not capturing any of their WC data in their profiles - none of the data they provide is being entered into their profile and there's no place to upload the documentation they send to us. I don't think we need text fields for policy company name or policy number if we are going to upload the policy itself. However I do think we should capture coverage start date and coverage end date. Knowing these dates will allow us to determine if the adjuster had coverage during the days they were deployed to a project (since the projects should capture start and release dates) and could also help us track adjusters who have expired policies - maybe having those with coverage end date after "today" can automatically turn to invalid documentation.
